title: Properly reset the bitset/variable cache whenever the ECM ID changes
message:
Properly reset the bitset/variable cache whenever the ECM ID changes

This fixes a bug where when switching between different ECM types, the
app would operate on incorrect offset/size definitions, causing corrupt
EEPROM and RT values.

message:
Add support for optimized burning

When enabled via preferences, only pages with local changes are written
back to the ECM when burning the EEPROM.

title: It's called 'BLUETOOTH_ADMIN', twit!
message:
It's called 'BLUETOOTH_ADMIN', twit!

This should *really* fix BT connectivity issues on Acer Icona and
RAZR devices.

title: Prepare v0.93
message: Prepare v0.93

title: Require BT_ADMIN permission for picky devices
message:
Require BT_ADMIN permission for picky devices

EcmDroid is unable to connect to the properly paired BT modem on some
android ports (e.g. Acer Icona Tab, Motorola RAZR D1/3). Workaround this
by requesting BT_ADMIN permissions.

message:
Refresh Log Recording View whenever focused

This ensures that the log statistics are up-to-date, even if the bike
was turned off before recording was stopped.

Fix "Read baro at key-on" config (Airbox Pressure Sensor Setup)

The checkbox was wrongly bound to bit 2 of the baro configuration
instead of bit 0. Thanks to Frank for spotting this bug.

title: Prepare v0.9
message: Prepare v0.9

title: [Logrecorder] Don't hog the CPU with no-delay set
message:
[Logrecorder] Don't hog the CPU with no-delay set

When logging over a fast connection (TCP/IP) and "no-delay" is set, the
device can become unresponsive. We therefore have to yield the reader
thread for at least 50ms after each frame to prevent this.

title: [LogRecorder] Add support for Bin2Msl conversion

title: [Setup] Honor the EEPROM burning preference
message:
[Setup] Honor the EEPROM burning preference

Previously, even though EEPROM burning was disabled in the preferences and
could not be triggered within the EEPROM view, clicking 'Apply' on the
setup view circumvented this setting.

title: Implement EEPROM Saving and Loading

Implement EEPROM Saving and Loading

Saved files are (currently) incompatible with ECMSpy since the first 5
bytes hold the ECM ID. This prevents the Spy from recognizing the EEPROM
data.
